DataElement.preferredName: Lumbar Puncture Prior Steroid Therapy Performed Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to a procedure in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid or to give drugs was completed earlier before giving corticosteroid drugs to reduce symptoms of inflammation treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lumbar Puncture Prior Steroid Therapy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a procedure in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid or to give drugs was completed earlier before giving corticosteroid drugs to reduce symptoms of inflammation treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid or to give drugs.

Concepts.definition: An invasive procedure in which a hollow needle is introduced through an intervertebral space in the lower back to access the subarachnoid space in order to sample cerebrospinal fluid or to administer medication.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Treatment with corticosteroid drugs to reduce swelling, pain, and other symptoms of inflammation.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The use of exogenous steroids for the treatment of any disease or disorder.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
